data.enText: a dream that is very frightening or unpleasant

data.chText: 他仍然做噩梦梦见这场事故。
data.enText: He still has nightmares about the accident.

data.chText: 可怕的经历；难以处理之事；噩梦
data.enText: an experience that is very frightening and unpleasant, or very difficult to deal with

data.chText: 这次旅行成了一场噩梦，他们俩都病了。
data.enText: The trip turned into a nightmare when they both got sick.

data.chText: 谁也不知道是怎么回事——真是棘手至极！
data.enText: Nobody knows what's going on─ it's a nightmare !

data.chText: 填写了那么多的表格，真是太可怕了。
data.enText: Filling in all those forms was a nightmare.

data.chText: 对于大多数人来说，丧子之痛是最可怕的梦魇。
data.enText: Losing a child is most people's worst nightmare .

data.chText: 这件事如果继续下去就糟透了。
data.enText: If it goes ahead, it will be the nightmare scenario (= the worst thing that could happen) .

tr: a terrifying or deeply upsetting dream
a situation resembling a terrifying dream

value.def: A nightmare is a very frightening dream.

example.ex: All the victims still suffered nightmares...
example.tran: 所有受害者仍然被恶梦困扰。

example.ex: Jane did not eat cheese because it gives her nightmares.
example.tran: 简没吃奶酪，因为那会让她做恶梦。

value.def: If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you mean that it is very frightening and unpleasant.

example.ex: The years in prison were a nightmare.
example.tran: 监狱里的那些年是一场噩梦。

value.tran: 令人恐怖的处境;可怕的情景

value.def: If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you are saying in a very emphatic way that it is irritating because it causes you a lot of trouble.

example.ex: Taking my son Peter to a restaurant was a nightmare...
example.tran: 带我儿子彼得外出吃饭简直糟糕透了。

example.ex: In practice a graduate tax is an administrative nightmare.
example.tran: 毕业税具体操作起来不啻一场行政噩梦。

value.tran: 恼人的情景;惹人烦的局面
